intro: Wettsteinia, commonly known as the desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. It consists of a single species, Wettsteinia galilaea, which is native to the arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in hot, dry climates and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Wettsteinia is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
